diff: +	* Bug in GTK. While performing a gtk_enumerate_printers(), GTK finds all of the
+	* available printers from each backend and can hang. If a backend requires more
+	* time to gather printer info, GTK will start an event loop waiting for a done
+    * signal before continuing. For the Lpr backend, GTK does not send a done signal
+    * which means the event loop never ends. The fix is to check to see if the driver
+    * is of type Lpr, and stop the enumeration, which exits the event loop.
+		// widget could be disposed at this point
+		// widget could be disposed at this point

members.signatureBeforeChange: int kEventRawKeyDown (int nextHandler, int theEvent, int userData)
members.signatureAfterChange: int kEventRawKeyDown (int nextHandler, int theEvent, int userData)
diff: -	* Bug in the Macintosh.  When the default handler calls TXNKeyDown()
-	* for a single line TXN Object, it does not check for the return key
-	* or the default button.  The result is that a garbage character (the
-	* CR) is entered into the TXN Object.  The fix is to temporarily take
-	* focus away from the TXN Object, call the default handler to process
-	* the return key and reset the focus.
+				* Bug in the Macintosh.  When the default handler calls TXNKeyDown()
+				* for a single line TXN Object, it does not check for the return key
+				* or the default button.  The result is that a garbage character (the
+				* CR) is entered into the TXN Object.  The fix is to temporarily take
+				* focus away from the TXN Object, call the default handler to process
+				* the return key and reset the focus.
+				* Feature in the Macintosh.  Tab characters are inserted into a single
+				* line TXN Object.  While this may be correct platform behavior, it is
+				* unexpected.  The fix is to avoid calling the default handler.
